page.title: 16SITHNEY
page.content:
This small village is situated about two miles north-west of Helston. It grew up to accommodate and service the {Carnmeal}miners. The name Sithney originates from an Irish Saint called {Sethnie}. At one time a workhouse existed in the village which housed the very poor. A public house called {The Old Tree Inn}was established during mining times and it thought that the establishment of this public house was used as an outlet for locally{smuggled brandy.}
Today people in the village are either retired or work in the nearby town of Helston.
